p: In vitro assessment of the oil antiproliferative activity was carried out using the Promega CellTiter 96 ® AQueous Non‐Radioactive Cell Proliferation (MTS) assay to evaluate the number of viable cells in media (Promega 2005). The oil was applied to test wells at concentrations of 5, 10, 20, and 50 mg/ml and incubated at 37ºC with 5% CO 2 for exposure period of 48 hr. After the completion of the incubation time, the MTS mixture (20 μl/well) was employed. A microplate enzyme‐linked immuno‐assay (ELISA) reader was utilized to read absorbance of the formazan product at 492 nm. Each point was performed in triplicates (Bardaweel et al., 2015).
